meanings.definition: To make or become softened or tenderized.
meanings.sent1: After marinating in the special sauce, the meat was intenerated and ready to grill.
meanings.sent2: The chef intenerated the vegetables by cooking them slowly in butter.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion intenerated the tough leather boots into soft slippers.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words intenerated his hardened heart, making him feel loved.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun intenerated the snow, turning it into a slushy mess.

meanings.definition: To make or become less severe or harsh.
meanings.sent1: The teacher intenerated the punishment by giving extra credit assignments.
meanings.sent2: The storm intenerated into a gentle rain, calming the fears of the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The strict boss intenerated his tone when praising the hardworking employees.
meanings.sent4: His apology intenerated her anger, and they were able to reconcile.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music intenerated the tense atmosphere, creating a peaceful ambiance.
